value.title: Understanding LOOKUPVALUE
value.excerpt: This article provides full coverage of the LOOKUPVALUE internals, alongside several performance considerations. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670739?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/EDqG29flu4Y" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: USERELATIONSHIP in calculated columns
value.excerpt: Learn why USERELATIONSHIP is easy to work with in measures, but it can be challenging and give you inaccurate results when used in calculated columns. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/k6uSnlr62fg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
value.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JS-K2faCiCc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
